> The only reason why they stop splitting is because of the exp..!

I disagree.  If you start with a slime with experience level between 100 and 200, they usually stop 
multiplying because of the reach the artificial limit on the number of characters in the screen. [An interesting experiment
might be what would happen if you disabled the limit and you had a very, very large field to play on so that the problem 
with multiplying became a lack of space.  Could you ever hope to beat that scenario?]

  Also, they stop multiplying
because their mana reaches 50.  I've also had generic slime of experience level 5 show up.  I think it might be after a 
slime mutliplies x number of times, every new slime formed from that one becomes generic.
  
> Well, i haven't played gladiators for a couple of months.. but I remember well (due to a buncha experimentations!)

I haven't had time to play Gladiator lately.
  
> Anyways, hope that'll help.

Any discussion helps.
